application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.p: University of the Basque Country System for NIST 2010 Speaker Recognition Evaluation .=
M. Penagarikano, A. Varona, M. Diez. L.J. Rodriguez-Fuentes, G. Bordel .=
GTTS, Department of Electricity and Electronics University of the Basque Country, Spain e-mail:mikel.penagarikano@ehu.es .=
24/06/2010 - 25/06/2010 NIST SRE10 Evaluation Workshop, Brno, Czech Republic 1.=
Partitioning of the previous SRE databases .=
spkrs SRE04 SRE05 SRE06 SRE08 FU08  Universal Background Models (UBM) .=

SRE05 0 525 348 0 0  SVM Impostors (IMP) SRE06 0 348 949 112 0  Z-Norm score normalization (SN-ZNorm) SRE08 0 0 112 1336 150  T-Norm score normalization (SN-TNorm) FU08 0 0 0 150 150  Development set .=
IMP 2780 2094 4874 signals SRE08 SRE08* devA devB .=
24/06/2010 - 25/06/2010 NIST SRE10 Evaluation Workshop, Brno, Czech Republic 2.=
• Qualcomm-ICSI-OGI noise • 13MFCC, CMS, FW, ∆+∆∆ • Gender dependent reduction (Wiener Filter) • Sautrela Toolkit • 1024 components .=

• SUNSDV-SRE08 recipe • BUT Matlab JFA recipe • Eigenchannels: 20+20+40 • Feature domain CC from Suff-Stat • 200 eigenvoices • Sautrela Toolkit + SVMTorch • Sautrela Toolkit + SVMTorch • 100 eigenchannels .=
• Channel type condition: 1MIC , 0MIC , 2MIC • Channel & gender dependent ZT .=
• Side info conditional fusion & calibration (channel type + gender) • Hard accept/reject decisions by Bayes threshold of 6,907 • FoCal Toolkit .=
24/06/2010 - 25/06/2010 NIST SRE10 Evaluation Workshop, Brno, Czech Republic 3.=
